body_html:
The shape of a is unknown, see tf.Dimension. Could you clarify where is wrong?

If we are to provide placeholders for both the label and logits arguments, shouldn't they both have the shape (?, # of classes)? If for example in the above snippet a has only one dimension then there is no way this is an input with correct shape so shouldn't tensorflow warn about it?
body_text:
The shape of a is unknown, see tf.Dimension. Could you clarify where is wrong?

If we are to provide placeholders for both the label and logits arguments, shouldn't they both have the shape (?, # of classes)? If for example in the above snippet a has only one dimension then there is no way this is an input with correct shape so shouldn't tensorflow warn about it?
body:
> The shape of `a` is unknown, see [tf.Dimension](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/Dimension). Could you clarify where is wrong?

If we are to provide placeholders for both the `label` and `logits` arguments, shouldn't they both have the shape (?, # of classes)? If for example in the above snippet `a` has only one dimension then there is no way this is an input with correct shape so shouldn't tensorflow warn about it?
